name: procenv

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
A command-line tool that displays as much detail about itself and its
environment as possible. It can be used as a test tool, to understand
the type of environment a process runs in, and for comparing system
environments.

dependencies.name: check
dependencies.description:
Check is a unit testing framework for C. It features a simple interface
for defining unit tests, putting little in the way of the developer.
Tests are run in a separate address space, so both assertion failures
and code errors that cause segmentation faults or other signals can be
caught. Test results are reportable in the following: Subunit, TAP, XML,
and a generic logging format.

dependencies.name: expat
dependencies.description: Expat is an XML parser library written in C.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: libpcap
dependencies.description: libpcap is a portable library in C/C++ for packet capture.
